title: ChatGPT crosses 100 million weekly users in India; 18–24-year-olds send half the messages: OpenAI
snippet: OpenAI has revealed that 50% of ChatGPT messages in India come from users aged 18-24. The country has surpassed 100 million weekly active users, with 35% using the tool for work tasks, the data reveals

title: Are DeepSeek Moments Now the New Normal?
snippet: A little-known Chinese AI company recently released an open-source reasoning model that challenged Western dominance and was developed at a fraction of the cost. And no, it’s not DeepSeek.

title: iPhone 17 available for  ₹44,768 during Croma Everything Apple Sale: here's how the deal works
snippet: Apple's iPhone 17 is now available for under  ₹50,000 during Croma's Everything Apple Sale, with discounts through trade-ins and bonuses. The phone was launched by Apple during its flagship launch event in September last year.

title: India must develop sovereign AI to avoid digital colony risk, says Sarvam AI Co-founder Vivek Raghavan
snippet: Building foundational AI technology is a necessity rather than an option for India to maintain its digital independence, said Sarvam co-founder, Vivek Raghavan. He noted that AI impacts every aspect of human life, making it a core technology that the country must understand at a fundamental level. "

title: Cheaper AI inference and open architectures essential for mass adoption: Nandan Nilekani
snippet: Artificial Intelligence serves as a fundamental construct for large-scale societal transformation when integrated with open networks and decentralised ecosystems. title: Google launches ‘Photoshoot’ feature in Pomelli to automate high-end ad creation: here's how it works
snippet: Google Labs has introduced Photoshoot in its Pomelli platform, enabling small businesses to create professional product images using Gemini Nano Banana. Users can upload images, select templates, and the AI generates on-brand visuals for websites and social media, enhancing marketing efforts.

title: Antonio Guterres at AI Impact Summit: ‘Less hype, less fear' – IPCC-style UN panel aims for ‘human control’ of AI
snippet: At the India AI Impact Summit 2026, UN chief Antonio Guterres emphasised the need for a balanced approach to AI, advocating for less hype and fear while promoting human oversight.&nbsp;

Tech leaders are all in on AI; the public, not so much
snippet: Silicon Valley touts AI as revolutionary, but public skepticism is high. Surveys show limited workplace impact, widespread fear, and strong support for regulation.

title: Cybersecurity stocks hit sharply by Anthropic 'Claude Code Security'
snippet: Shares of companies in the cyber security solutions space have nosedived after America-based AI company Anthropic PBC unveiled a tool that is capable of autonomously finding and patching possible software vulnerabilities.

title: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI considered alerting Canadian police about school shooting suspect months ago
snippet: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI said Friday it considered last year alerting Canadian police about the activities of a person who months later committed one of the worst school shootings in the country's history.

title: OpenAI expects compute spend of around $600 billion through 2030
snippet: OpenAI ​is targeting roughly $600 billion in total compute ​spend through 2030, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday, as the ChatGPT maker lays groundwork for an ‌IPO that ⁠could ⁠value it at up to $1 trillion.

title: Microsoft Gaming head Phil Spencer retires, insider Asha Sharma takes over
snippet: Microsoft said on Friday gaming head Phil Spencer is retiring after 38 years at the software maker, in a major leadership shake-up. title: Innovation and trust will steer our AI future: Credo AI CEO

title: ‘Frugal’ Sarvam AI did a DeepSeek with just 40 researchers
snippet: Sarvam is already deploying its models in enterprise and government use cases, including voice AI and language technologies. Cofounder Pratyush Kumar said the company trained multiple models internally, without relying on any external technology stack.

title: AI superpark in Bengaluru to generate data for world models
snippet: Umakant Soni, cofounder of Bharat1.ai, said the idea of the park is to create AI models grounded in the real world and the park is equipped with robots, GPUs and researchers, which will create data for the real world.

title: Indian IT captains hold firm amid raging agentic AI storm
snippet: K Krithivasan, chief executive officer and managing director of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), said while it’s not clear exactly what the roles will be a few years down the line due to disruption owing to AI, he does not envisage a “significant shrinkage” to TCS and the industry at large.

title: Measles cases are rising. Other vaccine-preventable infections could be next.
snippet: There’s a measles outbreak happening close to where I live. Since the start of this year, 34 cases have been confirmed in Enfield, a northern borough of London.
